page.title: 11Tourism
page.content: The Caldon Canal is the main tourist attraction, now that it is navigable, now accessible from Stoke-on-Trent and links up to the main canal network. Its towpath provides pleasant walks and the flint mill with its twin wheels and working machinery is a great attraction. The Cheddleton Steam Railway is growing as more rolling stock is aquired, but it relies on British Rail allowing it to use their line for any special journeys. The area is not renowned for its tourism, as the village is not particularly pretty and just off the main road road along which most tourists are travelling to other better known beauty spots.
